intro: Pelexia ochyrae, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pelexia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant features slender stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a fine pubescence. Its small, greenish-white flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Pelexia ochyrae is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks.
